name: FIESTAR
intro: (피에스타) was a girl group formed in 2012 by and signed under FAVE Entertainment. They originally debuted with six members on August 31, 2012 with the single "Vista". They disbanded on May 15, 2018 after four of the members' contracts ended on April 30 and decided not to renew. While many of the members took part in various activities before the group's formal debut, according to their agency, all of them had been training together for two years and the average training time among the members was 4 years. Cao Lu was previously a solo singer in China after winning a 2004 CCTV sponsored singing contest. Her album, titled , was released in 2005 under her former stage name, LuLu. Yezi also became known as an underground rapper before she debuted. She released various mixtapes on her account and got high and positive praises from netizens before she was planned to become a member of FIESTAR. Jei modelled for many online clothing stores and was a female lead for 's M/V for their song "Paradise", Bongshil Sister's "My Love" and as well as Taw's M/V for "Happy Hours (feat. Joo and the Lifestyle)". Jei replaced Joo on the promotions since Joo was diagnosed with a bump on her throat, Joo was luckily just fine after the promotions ended. Linzy was trained at YG Entertainment and was originally planned to be a member of . She was also one of the trainees to be originally scheduled to be in the company's new female group (with the idea scrapped in 2012, and the group disbanded even before debuting). She also recorded a song for the 2010 Korean drama . LOEN Entertainment announced that they would be debuting a 6-member girl group with not only members from South Korea, but also from China (Cao Lu) and the United States (Cheska). After the reveal of their profiles, it was announced that they would be collaborating with label mate before debut. Their song "Sea of Moonlight" has ranked quite high on Korean music charts. In August, FIESTAR's debut single "Vista" was announced. It was also revealed that they would be collaborating with hip-hop artist Tiger JK for a pre-release song titled "Wicked", which garnered lots of attention for its reggaeton influence. 's Junsu made an appearance in the M/V for "Vista", along with Seungah from Sunny Hill. "Vista" ranked high on Korean charts, along with the other songs which all charted on the K-pop Billboard Hot 100, with 2 songs ranking up to the Top 10. On November 1, Cheska revealed the girls were planning to comeback, which was later confirmed by LOEN following the release of the teaser image, along with the comeback date of November 9, 2012 with their second single album, . "We Don't Stop" is revealed to be with the works of Hyuk Shin. The B-side for single, "Sweet Love", was released on November 5 and featured ballad singer Kim Yeon-woo. The promotions followed on Music Bank on November 10, 2012. The members had individual activities, like for example Jei appearing in TVN's love-reality show, , with 's Hyejeong, 's Jihyun, and other K-pop idols. Members Jei, Cheska, and Yezi appeared alongside for the hilarious comedy show, . Linzy and Hyemi were in KBS's singing show . FIESTAR as a whole also appeared in and . They also group-made an endorsement with . FIESTAR begun the new year by ending their promotions of "We Don't Stop" on , and appearing on KBS' . Cao Lu also was on . They were on shows again during May 2013, appearing on various shows. The group as a whole appeared on SBS' , KBS' , MBC Music's with only Cao Lu on the show , along with . Jei also appeared on their brother group 's individual teasers of each 5 members, with the theme "Romantic Dating Tips". Member Linzy also joined the cast of the Korean musical rendition of the 2006-2008 musical movie hit, — taking the role of Sharpay Evans, sharing the role with The Grace's Dana. The musical also shows a grand cast with 's Ryeowook, 's Jaejin, 's Luna, 's ChoA and musical actress Oh So-yeon. The photoshoot begun on June 28, and the show begun on July 2 at Blue Square Samsung Card Hall. On July 25, LOEN released a picture with Jei, Cheska, and Cao Lu holding up a book while looking at the camera, and told that FIESTAR will be making an educational program called , for international viewers who want to learn Korean. The first video is released on July 26, with their main topic, "Daebak" (which means "awesome" or is the equivalent of "wow!"), with Jei speaking Korean, Cheska in English, and Cao Lu translating it into Mandarin Chinese. Fiestar made a CF for Samsung's Zoom Camera feature for the Samsung Galaxy S4, with a commercial that was released on June 30. Jei had a pictorial on , which hinted of a comeback somewhere beginning on the second half of 2013, and another album with the help of Eric Benét. Member Cheska also updated their fancafe, hinting of a comeback drawing near as well. Their comeback was announced on August 22 with a digital single, and is said to be with the works of Eric Benét. The digital single is titled "Whoo!", with a sneak peek 10-second audio clip released at the end of the group's 5th lesson video. LOEN Entertainment announced that "Whoo!" will just be a pre-release single for their upcoming comeback. The song collaboration with Eric Benét is released on August 27, and featured latin R&B music, introducing a new sound from FIESTAR. The song ranked high on music charts, despite no live promotions. In September, LOEN announced a major reorganization and created a multi-label system, splitting LOEN into two parts: LOEN Tree, which houses , and SunnyHill; and Collabodadi, which owns Zia and FIESTAR. Few days after the creation of the multi-label system, their agency's Twitter released a statement that FIESTAR will indeed have a comeback in November 1, and on the same day will also release BTS videos of their music video for their third single. On FIESTAR's 12th episode of , the whole six members released an audio teaser at the end of the video, and hinted more of the audio on FIESTAR's thirteenth episode and last of the Season 1 of . A few days later, on October 23, FIESTAR released a black-and-white teaser image of their third single, titled . They also released another teaser on October 28, featuring the girls making a 'Shh!' pose, and on the same day, released the album jacket image and the tracklist for their third single, with the lead single entitled "I Don't Know". They announced that FIESTAR will be sporting the cutely sexy concept, doing a 90 degree change on their image, and said it will be still as powerful as their former singles. They released the video teaser on October 31, and on the same day, various celebrities released supporting messages to FIESTAR, featuring Clara, , Kim Suk Hoon, and the team. They released the full music video on November 1. The single ranked high on digital music charts despite the heavy competition with fellow artists. They made their first comeback stage on on November 2. The group had their own TV reality show titled , broadcasted on SBS MTV. Their program features skits, activities, commercials, and the private lives of each member. The show's first episode aired on November 28. On March 20 their label announced Cheska would be withdrawing from the group after a long conversation with the agency. They also announced that FIESTAR would not be adding any new members. Their comeback was scheduled for mid-July 2014 after being pushed back due to the Sewol ferry tragedy. On June 16, a cheering song for the 2014 Brazil World Cup titled "I Love Korea", a collaboration between The Friends and FIESTAR was released. Teasers for FIESTAR's comeback single "One More" were released on June 29, the music video was released on July 1 and the song was released on July 2. On February 16, it was announced that FIESTAR will come back in March with their first mini-album composed of six songs, with most being co-written by Linzy and Yezi. The album was released on March 4, with the title track " ". From September 11, Yezi is part of the cast of the show . She ends up as a semifinalist and will garner attention during her performance of the song "Crazy Dog" which saves her from being eliminated. The song is out on digital platforms on December 11. On January 21, Yezi releases her first maxi-single " " including five songs; "Cider", its instrumental, " " and two brand new songs. On February 28, Cao Lu teases for the group's comeback in March during an interview. Their second mini-album , as well as the title track "Mirror" and it's M/V, was released on March 9. On May 17, the group announced that their comeback with digital single was set for May 31. On May 15, 2018, it was reported that the contracts of Linzy, Hyemi, Jei and Yezi all expired in late April and the members chose not to renew with the company. The song "One More" was banned by MBC for containing "ambiguous" and provocative lyrics, which the network claimed has allusions to a threesome. While the lyrics originally passed

As of April 2020, she is currently active as a Twitch streamer.

name: f(x)
intro: (에프엑스) was a five-member girl group under . They officially debuted on September 5, 2009 on MBC's by performing their first single "La Cha Ta", which was released on the 1st. The group received the title of "Asian Pop Dance Group" by their label and are touted as a multinational group since f(x) consists of members from China, United States and South Korea. The group largely went inactive since 2016 with no news of new releases as the members pursued individual activities. The group (without Victoria) performed together for the first time in three years at the concert in August 2019. On September 1, 2019, Amber announced via her social media accounts that she had not renewed her contract with SM Entertainment. On the day of the group's 10 year anniversary, September 5, SM Entertainment shared that both Luna and Victoria have chosen not to renew their contracts with SM, while member Krystal still has time remaining before her contract expires.

members.name: Sulli
members.intro: (설리) was a South Korean singer-songwriter, actress and model under . She was a member of the girl group , but left the group on August 2015 to focus on her acting career. In June 2019, it was announced that Sulli was set to make a return to the idol scene. She debuted as a soloist on June 29, 2019 with the digital single album " ". On October 14, 2019, Sulli passed away at her home in Seongnam, Gyeonggi-do in a suspected suicide. Sulli was born March 29, 1994, in Busan, South Korea. In 2005, Sulli joined and debuted as a child actress at age 11 in the SBS drama . She had various roles in multiple films over the next four years until her idol debut on September 5, 2009 in the girl group with the digital single " ". Following her debut as an idol, Sulli returned as an actress and starred in as lead in in 2012. In 2013, Sulli became the face of makeup brand Etude House along with fellow f(x) member . In 2014, Sulli appeared in hit films, and . During promotions for , Sulli took a break from all activities due to being mentally and physically exhausted from the continuous, malicious comments and false rumors that had been spread about her. SM Entertainment later announced to take legal action against the individual spreading malicious rumors. Two months later, SM announced the person behind the rumors was caught and filed a suit against them on charges of defamation. However, charges against the accused were dropped by SM and Sulli after the accused apologized. On August 7, 2015, SM announced that Sulli had left f(x) to focus on her acting career. On November 9, 2018, Sulli was a featured singer in 's single " ". Sulli later made her return to music on June 29, 2019 to debut as a soloist with the digital single album " ". The same day, a special stage titled was held in SM Town Theatre. On October 14, 2019, Sulli was found dead at her home in Seongnam, Gyeonggi-do by her manager who was unable to reach her the day before. It was later confirmed by the police with the cause of death under investigation under the assumption that she took her own life. Sulli first attended Jungbu Elementary School in Busan and later transferred to Seoul Cheongdam Elementary School. After completing her primary education, she attended Chungdam Middle School and later graduated from the Department of Theatre & Film in the . In August 2014, media outlet Dispatch published a series of photos that appears to revealed Sulli out on an evening date with 's . Dispatch reported that an acquaintance of both said the two were in ambiguous state of their relationship when they were first captured together in August of last year. Since then, their relationship continued to progress. Soon after the publication of the "date" photos, SM Entertainment along with confirmed that the two were in a relationship. In March 2017, according to Star News, Sulli and Choiza were reported to have broken up after two years and seven months since they were first revealed to be dating. Their breakup was confirmed by both of their agencies with Amoeba Culture stating: "Because it's our artist's personal life, we want to be cautious, but due to a lot of interest and concern, we're releasing a statement. Choiza and Sulli, due to their busy schedules and different ways of life, naturally grew apart. The time they spent together will remain as a good memory, and they will be moving forward as friends and colleagues." A few months later after her breakup with Choiza, Sulli and band director Kim Min-joon were confirmed by Dispatch to be in a relationship after dating for two months in May, beginning their relationship in March. Two months later in July, Kim Min-joon announced their breakup on his private social media channel, writing to his fans: "Since the beginning of our relationship was revealed to everyone in a situation without our say, I am writing this because I think I should also reveal the end. Choi Jin-ri and I have decided to go our separate ways."

members.name: RiSe
members.intro: (리세) was a Japanese singer under . She was a member of the girl group . On September 3, 2014, the group was returning to Seoul after finishing their recording for KBS's in Daegu when they were involved in a car accident. The manager lost control of their vehicle after speeding in rainy conditions, leading to the back tire falling out and the van running into a wall. was immediately killed while RiSe was left in critical condition, succumbing to her injuries four days later on the 7th.

members.intro: (하루) is a South Korean singer under BRICKWORKS Company. She is a member of the girl group and a former member of the girl group . On August 25, 2015, Haru made her debut in 's girl group under the stage name U Jung. The group was announced to have disbanded after two singles on December 14, 2016. As a result, she left Maroo. After her departure from the agency, she decided to compete on Mnet's survival show . She was eliminated in episode 9, finishing in 26th place. On October 15, 2018, Ho1iday's official Instagram account introduced the final member to join their line-up to be Haru. They posted a picture Haru had uploaded to her personal Instagram account back in August of the same year, indirectly confirming Haru was U Jung. In an interview right after debut, it was confirmed that she and had previously debuted. On April 18, 2019, she made her debut with Ho1iday (now known as ) with a live performance of their debut song " " on .

name: EXO
intro: (엑소) is a nine-member boy group under . They debuted on April 8, 2012 with their first mini album, . The group originally consisted of twelve members; Xiumin, Luhan, Kris, Suho, Lay, Baekhyun, Chen, Chanyeol, D.O., Tao, Kai and Sehun, who were divided into two sub-units, and , one promoting in Korean and the other in Mandarin. Between 2014 and 2015, the group lost three of its members: , and , respectively, preferring to focus on their individual careers in China. In 2016, the first official sub-unit , consisting of Chen, Baekhyun, and Xiumin, debuted with the mini album . In 2019, their second official sub-unit called , consisting of Sehun and Chanyeol, debuted with the mini album .

members.intro: (카이) is a South Korean singer, actor, and dancer under . He is a member of the boy group , its sub-unit , and also a member of the supergroup . He graduated from School of Performing Arts Seoul (SOPA) in February 2012. On April 1, 2016, local media outlet reported that he and of were dating and it was confirmed by on the same day. In June, 2017, SM reported that the couple have broken up due to busy schedules of both sides. On December 31, 2018, rumors of a possible relationship between he and of began to take off when the same local media outlet of the last time posted pictures of the two together on a date, with the information that they also had spent time together in Paris back in October. On January 1, 2019, confirmed the pair were dating and gave the statement, " ". Later that day, also confirmed the news. On January 25, revealed that the couple had broken up, but did not reveal the reason for it.

intro: Prior to 2019, Fanxy Red was originally known as a five-member C-pop group named (formally due their collaboration with the brand Fantasy Football Confederation) and was formed by Zhejiang Huati Culture Communication Co. Ltd.. They released their debut single "Action" on April 28, 2017. In June 2017, Feng Yuxuan and Peng Yiyang (Joel) were added into group, making them seven-members. In November 2017, Acrush released their second single "I'm Sorry". The single and MV did not include Min Junqian who later announced her departure in December. In February 2018, Feng Yuxuan departed the group. In May 2018, the group was re-branded as Fanxy Red. In April 2019, Joel left, making them a four-member group. They re-debuted on August 28, 2019 with their debut single album " ", which was simultaneously released in China and South Korea.

members.name: Heo Chanmi
members.intro: (허찬미; also known simply as ) is a South Korean singer currently under Mostable Music. She is best known for being a former member of the co-ed group , the girl group and as a contestant in and later . Chanmi started in her career in 2004 where she signed with S.M. Entertainment as a trainee. She trained for a long time until she didn't make the final cut to be part of Girls' Generation due to the fact she was the youngest and was only in seventh grade. In October 2010, Chanmi debuted with under Core Contents Media. By 2013, Co-ed School was no longer active, allowing Chanmi to leave the group. In 2011, Chanmi debuted with a subgroup of Co-ed School, . Chanmi left F-ve dolls in 2012 to pursue her solo career that never came to fruition. She left Core Contents Media the same year. Chanmi then signed with as a trainee, but it was later revealed she was under . Duble Kick Entertainment reported that she would not participate in their own reality survival show, , instead, the company stated that they had plans for her to debut in another group. In 2017, Chanmi joined as a trainee under Mostable Music. She made it to the third round of eliminations and was eliminated. Her final rank was #20. In MIXNINE, it was revealed that she along with three other girls were preparing to debut under the agency's new girl group , however as of now, the debut has been cancelled for unknown reasons.

She officially debuted with them on July 31, with the release of the digital single " ". On March 10, officially disbanded. On September 14, she debuted again, now in the girl group , with the release of the studio album, , and its title track "Somehow". On April 30, it was announced that she would leave both group and agency to persue her acting career. On January 30, she signs with , and from now on, she would use the stage name Jo Seung Hee.

name: MVP
intro: The group first appeared in December 2015 with the release of a group teaser and promoted on the member's personal Instagram accounts until it was confirmed in March 2016. PH Entertainment revealed the member's stage names and profile photos in July 2016. On February 28, PH Entertainment revealed the group's name, MVP, and debut date. MVP would have their debut on March 13 with their first mini album titled , with "Take It" as the album's title track. On March 1, MVP released an intro video for , the video displays the group dancing an intense choreography. The debut album was produced by Avenger Seung, a producing team who also known for creating hit songs for BoA, S.E.S, Brown Eyed Girls, KARA, and Nine Muses. The agency also revealed that the main song, "Take It", has a "Glitchstep" genre, that fuses glitch , hip hop and dubstep. On March 3, the group released a teaser video for "Take It". The video shows the members getting prepared and walking through a corridor while accompanied by a strong rhythm. On March 7, the group released a second teaser video for "Take It", showcasing the choreography and the upbeat tempo of the track. On March 13, MVP officially debuted with their first mini album and the music video for their title track "Take It".

intro: (미드나잇) is a five-member trainee girl group under . They released their first pre-debut digital single, "MIDNIGHT Project Single Album Vol.1", on March 9, 2019. In September 2018, H&I Entertainment posted an audition notice on OTR looking for members of their upcoming girl group, which would debut either in the last half of 2018 or the first half of 2019. In November, they revealed the first three members of MIDNIGHT to be Danbi, Dami, and Byeoljji on their Instagram. In January 2019, it was announced through audition pages and the group's YouTube descriptions that MIDNIGHT would debut in April with five/six members. By this time, Dami had left the group and Danbi and Byeoljji had stayed. The same month, they introduced two new members, Serin and Yebin, through dance covers. A month later, in February, Jiwon was introduced through the '2018 BEST solo singer medley' dance cover posted on their YouTube channel. At this point, people started believing Serin had left the group due to the group account unfollowing her on Instagram and her not being a part of the cover videos they released previously. (Her stage name would later be stylized as J.won) The same month, another Jiwon, who went by the stage name Yudi, introduced herself as a member of MIDNIGHT on her personal Instagram. She was officially introduced on March 2, a couple of days before the release of their first single. As the other three members, she was also introduced through a dance cover. On March 9, the first part of the 'Girl Group's Flooded' project was released. What the project was about, was only explained in April, after the release of the second part of the project "Swish", in . They explained they would release a song every month until they would formally debut to express the members' various colors and charms. On April 8 and 9, H&I introduced two new trainees, Seyeon and Seungeun, as members of MIDNIGHT to replace Yudi, Jiwon, and Yebin, who had left the group in between releases. On April 19, MIDNIGHT uploaded a cover video by a new member: Cherry (but at the time using her birthname Yujeong). She was, however, never formally introduced as a member, and seems to have left the group after just a couple of days. An April debut fell through at the last moment as they had been posting about it until March 2. On June 5, revealed MIDNIGHT's debut was impending. Five days later, MIDNIGHT introduced Chaewon through an Instagram post as a new member, making MIDNIGHT a five-member girl group again. On July 23, a new member was introduced through a vocal cover of "Be Be Your Love" by Rachael Yamagata: Twitch streamer, actress, model, and singer Yunu. Three weeks later, on August 14, MIDNIGHT released a music teaser for their third pre-debut single. The teaser did not include Yunu and whether she is going to make an appearance in the music video the same style Yudi did, at the end of the music video, is not known right now. The group, however, had already finished shooting their music video before Yunu's introduction. On September 17, MIDNIGHT revealed they were working on their debut album while simultaneously working on their final project song, which they aim to release in December 2019. They have yet to decide whether this last pre-debut song will be put in a mini-album along with the other pre-debut songs, or if it will be a stand-alone single like the other three. On the same day, it became clear the rumors of Chaewon having left the group had been true. The article talking about MIDNIGHT's final project song introduced the group as a five-member girl group, did not Chaewon as a member and used a picture of MIDNIGHT's line-up excluding Chaewon. Not long after, Seyeon also left the group without any notice being given. Around the end of September/the beginning of October, MIDNIGHT started following a new girl on Instagram: Ha Yera. In the bio of her personal Instagram account, she revealed herself as a member of MIDNIGHT. But within a couple of days, she seems to have left the group again. She deleted the message asking for her followers to love her and MIDNIGHT, she unfollowed all the members and the group (and vice versa), and she removed MIDNIGHT from her bio. On October 22, an audition page for new members for MIDNIGHT was published on OTR. On the page, it was revealed that MIDNIGHT was aiming to debut in the early half of 2020. On December 5, MIDNIGHT introduced Eungyul through a vocal cover of 's " ". On December 18, Ahyeon was revealed through a vocal cover of " " by .

members.intro: (아현) is a singer, rapper and dancer. She is a former pre-debut member of . On December 18, 2019 MIDNIGHT uploaded their first video featuring Ahyeon: a cover of 's . MIDNIGHT's Instagram account unfollowed Ahyeon in February, 2020 around the time they were starting to tease a new release.

members.name: Yunu
members.intro: (유누) is a singer, rapper, actress, Twitch streamer, and model under . She is a former pre-debut member of . From late 2015 to early 2016, Yunu featured on several songs as a rapper. In April of 2017, Yunu competed as a special guest in , a charity boxing tournament Later that same year, Yunu made an appearance as a guest competitor on in the eleventh and twelfth episode, performing in the 1:3 match. In January of 2019, Yunu revealed she filmed her first action film: . The high school action film, in which she played one of the main characters (Sua), was released in June. In May, Yunu revealed she was also shooting for the upcoming drama . On July 27, Yunu was introduced as a new member of the upcoming girl group MIDNIGHT. Due to the time of her addition, she was unable to record " " with the group, but she did promote the song with the rest of the group on festivals and Pops in Seoul. In March of 2020, Yunu went on her Twitch channel and revealed she was not going to debut.

Ha Yera, first known by her stage name 'Hanbom' was added as the latest member to the lineup of girl group in December 2018, however, she left the group just after one month for unknown reasons and was replaced by . In later September 2019, the official account of began following a new unrevealed member 'Ha Yera'. In her bio, she revealed herself as a member of . However, just days after the reveal, on October 13, 2019, Ha Yera posted on her personal Instagram account that she was moving out of Daegu to start her new life and asked her followers to love MIDNIGHT and her a lot, signifying her departure from .

members.intro: (채하) is a South Korean singer. She is a former member of the girl group , a former pre-debut member of the girl group , and a former member of the project group . The group seems to have disbanded since, and Chaewon left UPVOTE Entertainment. On June 10, MIDNIGHT introduced Chaewon as their fifth member and final member before the recording of MIDNIGHT's third pre-debut single " " began. There were already some rumors going around that Chaewon had left the group right after the song was released, but there was no confirmation until September 17, when Segye released an article calling MIDNIGHT a five-member girl group, indirectly confirming Chaewon had left. On December 3, Daydream revealed their new line-up, including Chaewon. She took on the stage name Chae Ha to promote with Daydream.

name: Milkyway
intro: (루비레트) is a pre-debut four-member girl group under GG E&M Inc. Roovylette was formed as a six-member girl group on April 10, 2019. In July and August, Roovylette performed on several different festivals with the original line-up: Ayoung, Hyeyoon, Quokka, J.Soul, Siyeon, and Juhui. But on October 7, it became clear Roovylette had had a line-up change. Roovylette went from a six-member group to a five-member group with three new members: Dayou, Geumju, Minjung. Only Ayoung and Juhui remained from the previous line-up. In October, Roovylette's name changed to Milkyway, along with with their line-up: Ayoung, Juhui, and Dayou left, and Jinju joined. On November 2, Milkyway performed with four members for the first time. On November 17, she revealed her name to be Sohee.

members.intro: (민정) is a South Korean singer under GG E&M Inc. She is a member of the upcoming girl group , and a former member of the girl group and the kids' group . She was born in Yongin, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea. Before her joining , she debuted in a kids' girl group called , with a fellow member . She joined the group in October 2017, after pre-debut member announced her departure. She officially debuted in the group on November 27, 2017 with the release of " ". On January 26, 2019, a video titled "Bye Bye Minjung" was posted on Buster's company official YouTube channel, confirming her departure from the group. After her departure from the group, Minjung signed on with GG Agency, a newly established company. She joined the upcoming girl group (formerly known as Roovylette) after the group had their first line-up change.

members.name: Geumju
members.intro: (금주) is a singer, model, and actress under GG E&M Inc. She is a member of the pre-debut girl group . In April of 2016, Geumju appeared on the reality show alongside her twin sister . On the show, the twins talked about how they dreamed of becoming actresses even though their mother opposed the idea. The twins, who had been cast on the street and started acting out of curiosity about what it would be like, started making cameo appearances in several shows in the second grade of middle school. Their mother was worried the twins would not be eating well. Their father, however, was fully supportive of their girls' dream. He said all he wanted was his daughters to be happy. In 2018, the sisters were both trainees under Monstergram Inc. (now known as MARBLING E&M). Under this agency, Geumju became a part of the pre-debut four-member girl group Ping Pok. In January of 2019, the four-member girl group Ping Pok turned into the eight-member girl group . In February of 2019, Geumju and Jinju joined the trot survival show as a duo. They didn't make it past the audition. In April, they both joined GG E&M Inc. as trainees. On October 7, Geumju was announced as a new member of the upcoming girl group Roovylette after four of the previous members left the group. The group since rebranded as .

name: MOMOLAND
intro: (Korean: 모모랜드; Japanese: モモランド) is a six-member girl group under . Originally consisting of seven, they were formed through the survival reality show and officially debuted on November 10, 2016 with the mini album . In 2017, two new members were added to the group, being on March 28, and on April 9. Taeha and departed from the group on November 30, 2019. In June 2016, Mnet's survival program began, a reality show where a group of seven members (Yeonwoo, Hyebin, Jane, Nayun, Joo E, Ahin and Nancy) were selected from 10 trainees (including Daisy, Shinsia and Heejae). It was decided that the members were going to make their debut, but the Final Mission could not collect the target 3,000 spectators and there were about 2,300 citizens at the scene. So the official debut was delayed for a while to prepare for their debut, promotional events, fan meetings, and the street. On October 26, 2016, the group was appointed as ambassadors for the International Relief Development NGO Plan Korea, volunteered at the Pak Luong Village in Taipei, Vietnam from December 12 to 16, 2017, to encourage Happy Mov students to participate in Kindergarten construction service. In addition, the group had a cultural exchange event to villagers and Korean-Vietnamese culture and showed good response to the villagers by showing their songs on their debut album. According to the group interview by Celuv.TV, the first part of their name, MOMO, came from the 1973 German novel titled by Michael Ende, which the main character named Momo gives hope and dreams to many people, while "Land" means a place where people can go to, play to, and rest at times just like in an amusement park, there are various rides, specifically "Merry-Go-Round" (the official fandom name). Therefore, their name is like an amusement park theme and its goal is to provide hope that people of all ages and gender could enjoy their music and show their various sides. The group's debut showcase was held on November 9. On November 10, they released their mini album with the title track "Jjan Koong Kwang" and made their debut through . The group had a cameo on the April 4 episode of the tvN drama , where they played female trainees preparing for their debut through the drama’s fictional entertainment agency Soul Music and even had in-character performance of their debut title track "Jjan Koong Kwang". On March 13, it was announced that Daisy (originally a contestant in but was eliminated) and Taeha (former contestant) would be joining the group, increasing the group to nine members. On April 25, the group had a comeback through and their first single album " " was released. In the same year, on June 3, KBS 2TV played the EDM version of "Wonderful Love", which was released as a digital single on June 16 On July 22, the group performed the EDM version of " " on . On August 22, 2017, they released their second mini album, , debuting the title track "Freeze" through on the same day. On January 3, they made a comeback with their third mini album, with the title track "BBoom BBoom". The same month, Russian girl group Serebro accused MOMOLAND of plagiarizing their song "Mi Mi Mi" with "BBoom BBoom". The composer of the song, , denied the allegations by pointing out that "the bass line [is] commonly heard in retro house or swing electronic genres, as well as the 4-stanza chord." On January 11, they won their first music show award on Mnet's . On February 28, the group released their first best album in Japan consisting of Japanese versions of their songs including "JJan! Koong! Kwong", "Freeze", "Wonderful Love", and "BBoom BBoom". They then held promotional events in Tokyo and Osaka from February 28 until March 4, 2018, garnering 25,000 spectators over four days. Approximately 100 media also participated in the showcase held at Tower Records in Shibuya. The group also signed with King Records to release their upcoming debut single "BBoom BBoom" in Japan on June 13. In June, MOMOLAND starred in their first reality show called . The group filmed for the show in May while they were in Saipan for their music video of their Japanese version of "BBoom BBoom." The members were given 48 hours of free time, and they set off to enjoy various activities and cuisine. They also confided in each other and will reveal things they have not been able to through this reality show. The rshow consisted of 5 episodes only. On June 26, MOMOLAND made their comeback releasing its fourth mini album entitled with a fun dance track produced by Shinsadong Tiger, who also made "BBoom BBoom" from the mini album . On March 20, the group came back with their fifth mini album with "I'm So Hot" as the title track. Taeha and Daisy did not participate in the comeback due to health and personal reasons. On November 30, MLD announced the departures of Taeha and Yeonwoo, with Daisy still under discussions. On December 10, their agency announced that MOMOLAND will be releasing a single at the end of the month with six members. They later confirmed the single's title " " to be released on the 30th.

members.name: Yeonwoo
members.intro: In 2016, she became a contestant on Mnet's reality survival show . She finished the competition in fifth place, thus becoming a member of the girl group . The group officially debuted on November 10, 2016 with their first mini album . On November 30, 2019, MLD announced Yeonwoo's departure from the group due to focusing her career as an actress under the agency.

members.name: Daisy
members.intro: (데이지) is a South Korean singer under . She is the main rapper, main dancer and sub-vocalist of the girl group . She was one of the contestants of that did not make in the group, but was later added on March 28, 2017. She was born in Seoul, South Korea and later spent 11 years living in Vancouver, Canada. Like and , she speaks English fluently. She graduated from Jamil Art High School on February 2, 2018. Before she joined Duble Kick company, she was a trainee at and had intentions of going on the survival reality show but she left before the show began. She also participated in the survival reality show but was eliminated. In March 2017, she joined and successfully debuted together with the additional member of the group's official return in April. Daisy is in-charge as the main rapper of the group and replaced in position. She was a former host of with her fellow member . On January 7, 2020, KBS broadcast an interview with Daisy on . She claimed that was rigged, stating the agency already planned to place her into the group despite being eliminated and that the chosen members had to pay for the production costs. She also explained that she has been in conflict with MLD after being prevented from promoting with the group since May 2019. When requesting to have her contract terminated, her agency demanded a 1.1 billion won penalty for breaking the contract. MLD Entertainment denied the claims stating that they were one-sided and have asked for an official apology from KBS. On February 14, 2019, it was reported that she and 's have been been dating for three months. Her agency, MLD Entertainment, and Song's agency, , issued conflicting statements, the former confirming the report while the latter denied it, explaining that they have met a few times but are not dating.

The group officially debuted on November 10, 2016 with their first mini album On November 19, 2016, it was announced that she was a member of 's project girl group along with 's , 's , 's and 's .

members.name: Taeha (MOMOLAND)
members.intro: (태하) is a South Korean singer. She was the main vocalist of the girl group . She was born in Jeonju, South Korea. Originally her name was Kim Min-ji (김민지) but she legally changed it to Kim Tae-ha (김태하). She is the cousin of ’s . In 2009, she participated in the audition of the first season of competition show . She also appeared on Mnet's as a trainee under . She ranked 50th place in episode 8 and was eliminated. After , she left Starship and joined Dublekick Company (now MLD Entertainment). She joined as a member the girl group MOMOLAND in April 2017, preceded by , who was added on March 28, 2017, making them a 9-member girl group. On November 30, 2019, MLD announced Taeha's departure from the group, with her exclusive contract with the agency terminated.

name: MONSTA X
intro: (몬스타엑스) is a six-member boy group under . Formed through the survival show , they originally debuted as a seven-member group on May 14, 2015 with the mini album . On January 20, it was reported that MONSTA X were preparing for comeback in February. Starship confirmed the news on the 30th after announcing the group would appear on ahead of promotions. That same day, MONSTA X released a teaser video for their upcoming album titled to be released on February 18. The group released their fifth Japanese single " " on March 27. This was followed by their sixth single " " on June 12 and second Japanese album on August 21. MONSTA X began their third world tour in Seoul on April 13. The tour concluded on September 4 following 23 shows in 20 cities. The group released their seventh mini album on October 28. On October 31, Starship announced Wonho's departure from MONSTA X as he wish to not cause trouble to the group following recent allegations surrounding him. Starship will continue to take legal action against the malicious claims.

members.name: Wonho
members.intro: (원호) is a South Korean singer and dancer. He is a former member and visual of the boy group . He was also part of the project group . On October 31, 2019, announced his departure from MONSTA X as he wished to not cause trouble to the group following recent allegations surrounding him. The agency continued to take legal action against the malicious claims. The following day, Starship announced they had terminated his contract with the agency. Following the announcement of Wonho's departure, there was a large outcry from fans who protested the decision in multiple ways, trending hashtags on Twitter for weeks and funding billboards and fan projects in various countries. On March 10, 2020, Wonho was cleared of all charges by the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency and Starship announced that they would support his career in the future.

intro: (베리베리) is a seven-member boy group under . They debuted on January 9, 2019 with their first mini album . Jellyfish Entertainment confirmed on August 23, 2018 that they were planning to debut a new boy group that they have been preparing for a long time. They are set to make their debut on January 2019. On August 31, Jellyfish Entertainment revealed the group's name to be VERIVERY. On September 3, through 's YouTube channel, it was revealed that VERIVERY will star in an upcoming reality show named "NOW VERIVERY" prior to their debut. The first member, , was revealed on September 3 with a short video followed by two reveal photos and a behind the scenes video. Revealed in the same way was second member on September 4, third member on September 5, fourth member on September 6, fifth member on September 7, sixth member on September 10, and the seventh and final member on September 11. On September 14, a new Twitter account was opened for direct interaction and communication between the members and fans. Later on September 18, a teaser video was released for the music video of their debut title track, "Super Special", set to officially release on September 21. The music video was then released on September 21 at 18:00 (KST).

name: DIA
intro: (다이아; short for DIAMOND, also known as ) is a seven-member girl group under . They debuted on September 14, 2015 with the album . On September 14, 2015, the group made their official debut with the release of their first studio album, " ", and its title track "Somehow". A few months later, on October 20, the group released their first digital single, a track from their debut album, " ". The single features a version of the song featuring singer . On December 17, stated that members and would withdraw from group's activities to participate in Mnet's new survival reality show, . On March 7, without the two members, MBK Entertainment announced the addition of a new member to the group: . However, a few weeks later, on April 30, 's contract with the company expired and she decided not to renew it. When came to an end, Chaeyeon ranked 7th place and became a temporary member of the project group . Cathy, on the other hand, returned to DIA and changed her stage name to Huihyeon. On June 14, the group made their first comeback with the mini-album . It was the first release after Eunchae joined and Seunghee left the group. The release also marked the return of Chaeyeon who was promoting I.O.I's debut mini-album . On September 13, the group returned again, now with their second mini-album and their title track "Mr. Potter". On December 28, it was announced that the group would split into two sub-units for the release of a special single album. The first unit, called , is composed of members , Chaeyeon, Huihyeon and . They performed the song " " on December 29. The second unit, called , is made up of members , and Eunchae, and they would be responsible for the song " ", which would be released on December 31. As the return was a gift to fans, they only promoted it for a week in January. On April 5, it was announced that two new members would be joining the group: and . On April 19, 2017, the group made their third comeback with their second studio album, . It marked their first release with nine members. On August 22, DIA made their fourth comeback with the mini-album . Between the album's tracks, the two subunits of the group were present, revealing that Jueun was integrated into L.U.B, and Somyi into BCHCS. On September 3, it was announced that members and would be participating in KBS 2TV's idol rebooting survival show . Therefore, the group would promote with seven members during their absence. Before joining the survival, the two members released a collaboration song titled " " on September 28. On October 12, the group made a comeback with a repackage of the previous album, title . The repackage features the title track "Good Night" and also the collaboration "Seoraksan in October". On May 5, MBK Entertainment announced that would leave the group to focus on her health. On August 8, the group made their first comeback as an eight-member group, with the mini album and the title track "WooWoo". On March 19, 2019, the group made a comeback with the mini album and its title track "WooWa". Jenny did not participate in the album's recordings and promotions due to health concerns. On July 6, 2019, MBK Entertainment announced that would also leave the group to focus on her health. The agency also revealed that since last promotions with , Jenny had been suffering from severe knee pain, later being diagnosed with osteomalacia. Doctors advised her against continuing as an idol, and then, both Jenny and MBK agreed that she should henceforth stop all DIA activities and focus on her health and recovery.

name: MAMAMOO
intro: (마마무) is a four-member girl group currently under . They officially debuted on June 19, 2014 with the mini album . Before their debut, the girls released three pre-release singles including artists like , with " ", , with " ", and , with " ". After being featured on multiple singles, the group announced that their debut will be sometime on June. On June 15 they released an official music video teaser for "Mr. Ambiguous". On June 18, the group made their official debut with their first mini-album, , with the title song, "Mr. Ambiguous". Other songs included their per-release songs were included in the album. The song was described as a retro-inspired with a funk rhythm and a blues-rock chord progression, and showcases the group's "bluesy, soulful" voices. Lyrically, it is a warning to "Mr. Ambiguous", a man with confusing behavior who is not honest about his feelings. The song wasn't only a hit, but the music video featured tons of artists like, 's , Baek Ji Young, Wheesung, Jung Joon Young, Bumkey, K.Will, and Rhymer of Brand New Music. On the same day, they made their first live appearance on Mnet's . On November 5, MAMAMOO announced that a new album would be released later in the month. On November 16, they revealed the trailer to "Piano Man". On November 21, MAMAMOO released their second mini-album with the title track of the same name. "Piano Man" is a retro-inspired electronic swing dance song with a rhythmic piano melody and brass instrumentation. Lyrically, it is about a woman falling in love at first sight with the "piano man" Because of the popularity of both songs, they manage to win multiple Rookie Awards at the end of the year. On April 2, MAMAMOO released a surprise collaboration single with labelmate called " ". The song was produced, composed, and wrote by Esna. It is described as a funky dance song with a retro rhythm and intense blues guitar riff. Lyrically it tells men to stop using cliché pick-up lines, be a man, and treat women with respect. MAMAMOO and Esna made their comeback stage, and performed the song on M! Countdown on the same day. On June 11, the group unveiled a couple of introductory images for its upcoming mini-album. After multiple teasers, on June 19, they released the album with the title song, "Um Oh Ah Yeh". The song was described as an R&B dance song with elements of 1990s synthpop and was composed by Kim Do Hoon, CEO, and , , and . Lyrically, the song is about a girl who is in love with a man who is actually another girl. The song was a commercial success, topping in music charts. They also released an acapella version of the title song. On August 23, they held their first fan meeting called "1st Moo Party" and tickets for the event sold in one minute. They added an additional meeting for more fans the same night due to popular demand. On October 4, they held another "Moo Party" in Los Angeles, signifying their first trip to the United States. On January 26, 2016, MAMAMOO pre-released a digital single, an R&B ballad called " ", announcing their comeback for their first full album, , with all members working on the album. On February 12, " " was pre-released with an accompanying music video. The song is described as a hip hop song with a trap beat drop, written by Kim with lyrics co-written with Moonbyul, Solar, and Hwasa. The song depicts a comical rap battle inspired by the members' height difference of one centimeter. The full track list of the album was revealed on February 18. On February 26, they released the album with "You're the Best" as the title song. The song was described as a dance song with a retro groove, with three key and tempo changes and the song portrays MAMAMOO members' unique musical color most vividly. It was written by Kim, with lyrics by Moonbyul and Solar, and music by known producers, Duble Sidekick. The lyrics express how a girl feels when seeing a perfect man. The song was a commercial success, topping all of Korea's major music charts, and winning multiple awards in various music shows. On June 13, MAMAMOO announced that they will hold their first ever solo concert called . The concert is the girls' first solo concert since their debut 2 years ago, and is named so because the girls want to put on a concert that's as grand as a musical with the girls in the leading roles. Tickets to the show were sold out in less than a minute after opening to the public on June 22. On August 13 and 14, MAMAMOO held their first solo concert. On August 26, MAMAMOO announced via their official Facebook that they’ll be releasing two new tracks as sub-units. The first sub-unit is called the Angel Line consisting of , and , who is releasing the track " ". The second sub-unit consists of , and and is called the Rapper Line, who will be releasing the track " ". On September 21, they released the track , with an accompanying music video. On October 25, it was revealed that MAMAMOO will be making a comeback, with teaser images and tracklist posted on the following days. On November 7, was released with the title song "Decalcomanie". The song was a success, topping in some of major music charts in South Korea. On January 19, MAMAMOO announced that they will be holding their second solo concert called . As what happened from their previous concert, tickets to the show we're sold out in less than a minute after opening to the public on January 25. On June 6, they released a teaser image that showed the message, “Good news! We want to love again.” with various hex codes in the caption. The next day, they released a teaser for their fifth mini album titled and will expect a colorful new image for the group. The reason for the album title is “Purple is a mixture of red, which represents energy and passion, and blue, which represents limitless variety. The album will contain MAMAMOO’s diverse and splendid charms.” On June 22, the album was released. On December 27, MAMAMOO released a teaser image on their official Twitter account, showing the 4 members in gowns and with a text written in white saying "Coming Soon". The following day, another teaser was posted with the name of the release, " ".

name: LOONA
intro: (이달의 소녀; stylized as ) is a twelve-member girl group under . From October 2016 until June 2018, each member of the group was revealed along with a solo single album and a music video with sub-units being introduced as members are revealed. They currently have 12 active members along with 3 subunits. The full group held their debut concert " " on August 19, 2018, followed by the release of their debut mini album the next day. On September 26, 2016, the first teaser of member was released across multiple social media platforms including Youtube, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Teasers for " " were released until October 5, when the music video for "ViViD" was released. On October 28, the second member, was revealed in a similar manner. Teasers for "HyunJin" included HeeJin for their duet titled "I'll Be There" and solo teasers for HyunJin were released for her song "Around You". Her solo album, " " was released on November 17. On December 8, more than a month later, member continued the pattern by having teasers of her and her two fellow members. Her solo album, " " was released on December 15, including her solo "Let Me In" and a Christmas themed trio named "The Carol". On January 4, was revealed as the fourth member. Her solo album, " " was released on January 16, including her solo song "Kiss Later", HeeJin and HyunJin's duet "My Sunday", and HaSeul and YeoJin's duet "My Melody". On February 14, was revealed as the fifth member. It was revealed that LOONA will be in sub-units. LOONA's first sub-unit, , contains members, HeeJin, HyunJin, HaSeul, and ViVi. Their mini-album, , was released on March 13. Along with, were LOONA's first tv promotions exclusively on SBS' . On April 5, was confirmed as the "April Girl". Her single, " " was released on April 17, including "Everyday I Love You" featuring HaSeul and "Everyday I Need You" featuring future member JinSoul. On April 23, 's repackaged mini-album, , was revealed with teasers of the members and a teaser for "Love & Evil". was then released on April 27 with a single live stage on . On May 15, was revealed as the sixth member. Her single " " was released on May 23, with her solos "Eclipse" and "Twilight". On June 13, was revealed as the seventh member. Her single " " was released on June 26, including her solo "Singing in the Rain" and JinSoul and Kim Lip's duet "Love Letter". On July 7, LOONA 1/3's "Rain51db" music video was released. On July 10, a special music video for JinSoul's "Singing in the Rain" was released featuring member Heejin exclusively on V Live. On July 12, was revealed as the eighth member. On July 28, " " was released, featuring Choerry's solo, "Love Cherry Motion" and a duet with fellow member JinSoul, "Puzzle". On August 30, BlockBerryCreative revealed a teaser for the second sub-unit of LOONA, , which contains members Kim Lip, JinSoul, and Choerry. On September 19, the preview teaser for the lead single of an album by ODD EYE CIRCLE was released. The day after, the album was revealed in a preview as . The album was released on September 21 along with a music video release for the lead single, Girl Front. The subunit went making their live debut on and then . During this time, members HeeJin, HyunJin, and HaSeul were announced to participate in the idol survival show . On October 18, it was announced that a repackage album titled would be released. On October 23, the promised " " was released across international platforms. On October 31, was released along with a music video for the title track, "Sweet Crazy Love". On November 14, was revealed as the ninth member. On November 28, " " was released with her solos "new" and "D-1". On December 13, " " was released featuring ViVi, Choerry, and Yves under the transverse unit "ViRryVes" (pronounced as believe). On December 14, was revealed as the tenth member. On December 28, " " was released including her solo "Heart Attack" and Yves and Chuu's duet "Girl's Talk". On January 15, was revealed as the eleventh member. Two days later, the first ever official fan event was announced to be held on February 3. On January 30, " " was released including her solo "One & Only" and Chuu and Go Won's duet "See Saw" featuring Kim Lip. The fan event named "LOOΠΔ x Study Group" was held on February 3 in Theater 2, Seoul Cinema, South Korea. On February 28, a second fan event named "LOOΠΔ Cinema Theory: Up & Line" was announced to be held at Lotte Cinema World Tower, Seoul, South Korea on March 17; on the same day as the reveal of the next twelfth and final member. On the day, the member was revealed to be . On March 30, " " was released including her solo "Egoist" featuring JinSoul, and Go Won and Olivia Hye's duet "Rosy" featuring HeeJin. On April 14, a third fan event named "LOOΠΔ Premier Greeting: Line & Up" was announced to be held at YES24 Live Hall, South Korea on June 2 and June 3 featuring all 12 members and live music performances. On April 27, BlockBerryCreative revealed a teaser for the third sub-unit of LOONA, , which consists of members Yves, Chuu, Go Won, and Olivia Hye. On May 24, the preview teaser for lead single "love4eva" was released for their upcoming mini album . The album was released on May 30 along with a music video release for the lead single. The subunit went onto performing their lead single at their own event "LOONA Cinema Theory: Line & Up", at , , , and . Following the third sub unit's debut, on June 2 and June 3, the third fan event "LOOΠΔ Premier Greeting: Line & Up" took place at YES24 Live Hall, South Korea". On August 7, LOONA released " " as the lead single for their full group debut mini album, . They held their debut concert on August 19 and released the following day with "Hi High" as the title track. On January 1 at 12:00am KST, LOONA released a teaser video titled "X1X" featuring all the members and the numbers (1, 11, 21 and 31). They subsequently released teasers on January 11, 21, and 31. On January 4, BlockBerryCreative announced that LOONA would be holding their second concert on February 16 and 17 at Olympic Hall in Seoul. They released on February 19, which is a repackage of their debut mini album . The album contains six new songs including the title track "Butterfly". On December 10 at 12:00am KST, LOONA released a teaser image through their SNS with the number "365" and caption "Like the moon that shines 365 days". On the 13th at 12:00am KST, they released the teaser video for " " which was released later that day at 6:00pm KST as the lead single for their upcoming comeback. The single reached number 1 on the US iTunes singles chart, becoming the first Korean girl group to do so. On December 14, 2019, LOONA released a teaser video titled "#1". It was later confirmed he group would be coming back with the mini album titled (Hash) in the new year. On January 8, 2020, BlockBerryCreative announced that member Haseul will not partake in their upcoming comeback promotion schedules due to being diagnosed with anxiety, and will take a temporary hiatus until her recovery. The group will continue promotions with eleven members. On January 10, a second teaser video titled "#2" was released, confirming their comeback date to be February 5. The third teaser, "#3", was released on January 22. The fourth teaser and preview were released on the 30th and 31st, respectively.

members.name: HaSeul
members.intro: On December 8, 2016, HaSeul was revealed as the third member of girl group LOONA, and released her pre-debut single on December 15, 2016. In October 2017, HaSeul, along with fellow LOONA members and auditioned for survival reality show , but HaSeul was the only one who did not pass the auditions. On January 8, 2020, BlockBerryCreative released a statement stating that HaSeul had been diagnosed with recurring anxiety. In order to recover, it has been decided that she will be taking a temporary hiatus to focus on her mental health. Due to this, she will not be promoting the upcoming album .

name: LIPBUBBLE
intro: (립버블; also stylized as ) was a girl group under . They originally debuted with seven members on March 22, 2017 with their first single " ". On May 20, 2019, it was announced through the group's fancafe that they had disbanded. On November 4, the group introduced as the first member of the group. On November 11, the second member, , was introduced. On November 18, was introduced. On December 1, the three members did a street performance near Hongik University in Seoul, South Korea. On December 12, the fourth member, was introduced. On December 14, was introduced. On December 20, was introduced. On December 22, the last and seventh member, , was introduced. On March 9, the group revealed a teaser image for their debut single, " ". The image features all seven members dressed in red and white cheerleader uniform. Their debut single was set to be released on March 22. From March 16 to March 19, the group revealed individual teaser images for "Popcorn" where each members are shown wearing vibrant turquoise colored attire with a cheerleader-like vibe. On March 22, the group officially debuted with their digital single "Popcorn", shortly after that member Mirae left the group, followed by Ryua and Ina, leaving LIPBUBBLE as a four-member group. On October 17, Haea made a solo debut with the digital single " ". Members Eunbyeol and Hanbi were contestants on the idol rebooting show . They were eliminated on episode 7, with them ranking 60th and 53rd place, respectively. On May 10, it was officially announced that a new member, , was added to the group, making them a five-member group. Shortly after, Haea left the group for unspecified reasons. On August 27, it was announced that the group will make a comeback with two completely new members and , on September 7 with their second digital single " ". It was also confirmed that Mirae rejoined the group. Track "Yellow Pink" is an upbeat song, that tells the love stories of seven LIPBUBBLE members, title of the song is made up of two colors: "Yellow" symbolizing warmth and happiness and "Pink" representing love and femininity. On November 28, the group won their first award at the 26th Korean Culture Entertainment Awards in the Rookie Award category. On February 23, the group performed the song "Yellow Pink" on as a four-member group, with members Seoryn, Lia, and Ella being absent. In March, after a long period of inactivity, Lia and Ella left the group for unknown reasons, followed shortly by Seoryn. Their departures were silently confirmed in the video titled "[LipBubble Catch] The surprise party to celebrate the 2nd anniversary of LipBubble's debut" posted on the group's official YouTube channel on April 1, 2019. After her departure, Seoryn joined the dance studio 1MILLION. On May 20, Zenith Media announced the group's disbandment through the their fancafe.

Seven months later in October, the company made an announcement that the girl group is reorganized into an 24-member girl group with sub units, of which, Pureum would become the leader of sub unit . However, due to the frequent departures of members and the incompetence of the company, the number of members was reduced by more than half, therefore Pureum was transferred to the new sub unit, , by name only. Raychan auditioned for in 2017 but did not pass the preliminary auditions. On April 15, ONO confirmed that the group, then known by their pre-debut name ONO BOYZ, would be debuting in May. On April 18, the group revealed their official logo and their name to be LIMITLESS. ONO released the group's debut schedule on July 1 with their first single titled "Dream Play" to be released on July 9. On November 12, LIMITLESS announced that they will be coming back as a six-member group on November 28 with the release of their first mini album . On November 15, J-Jin and C.I were revealed as the group's newest members, both of whom are from China.

name: Unnies
intro: (언니쓰) was a special project girl group formed from the South Korean variety show . The group was formed in order to accomplish cast member, , dream of debuting as a member of a girl group. Season 2 of the show was formatted to focus on a girl group project. On the May 6 broadcast of , it was revealed that Min Hyo Rin's dream is to debut as a girl group member, as Hyo Rin had been a trainee at but was cut by the company, and they get help from Hyo Rin's CEO, founder of JYP Entertainment, as producer. On the May 13 broadcast, it was revealed that the song they'll be debuting will be named "Shut Up". On July 1, the group released the single and was met with critical acclaim and positive reviews, managing to grab an All-Kill, on the same day, the group officially debuted with their appearance on . The music video for the song was released on July 8, and it featured multiple guest appearances of Yoo Hui Yeol, Kim Jun Ho, Park Jin Young, of 9muses, of GOT7, and other celebrities as well. All profits from the single are reportedly donated towards helping people in need achieve their dreams. After the conclusion of season 1, the members in the group had changed. On January 17, a representative of the show revealed that and will be returning, while , , , , and have been confirmed as new cast members. On February 1, the first broadcast date was revealed along with a new concept image. Six days later, it was confirmed that renowned producer Kim Hyung Suk will be producing a new song for them with Kim Eana as lyricist.

members.name: Jessi
members.intro: (제시) is a Korean-American rapper and singer currently under . She is a former member of the hip-hop groups and and project girl group . She made her solo debut on December 1, 2005 with the single album " ", under the name . On December 1, 2005, she made her solo debut with the single album " " and performed the title song, "Get Up", on the TV program . A year later, in 2006, she was added in the hip-hop group , replacing their original vocalist, , and their debuted on May 25 with the studio album . On January 15, 2009, Jessi released her second single album, " ", and then, she took a break from music, travelling to America. On July 17, 2014, after five year on hiatus, Jessi debuted as a part of the hip-hop trio , under . From January to March 2015, she participated in the first season of . In 2016, Jessi was a member of the first season of the variety show and its group . The project group released their first single on July 1, 2016. On July 13, 2017, Jessi released her first mini album, . A year later, on July 6, 2018, she released her sixth and last digital single under , " ". On January 24, 2019, she signed with 's new agency, . Under the agency, she already released two singles, " " and " ".

members.intro: She made her solo debut on June 19, 2009 with the digital single " ". On January 4, she released the ballad digital single " ". She made a comeback on March 8 with her first studio album with "Love Tonight" as its title track. On August 23, Hong Jin Young posted on her personal Instagram stating she had filed a lawsuit against her agency, Music K, to terminate her exclusive contract in June due to being overworked and loss in payments. Her agency later released a statement rebutting the claims in her post. On September 19, she withdrew her application for contract termination after coming to an agreement with Music K. It was revealed on October 30 that she had set up her own one-man agency called IMH Entertainment and was preparing for a comeback.

members.name: Minzy (singer)
members.intro: (공민지), better known as , is a South Korean singer currently under . She was a member of the girl group and project group . She made her solo debut on April 17, 2017 with her first mini album . In 2009, Minzy, alongside then-labelmates , , and , debuted as members of 2NE1 with "Fire". Later that year, 2NE1 took a temporary hiatus as a group to release solo tracks, with Minzy and CL releasing "Please Don't Go" as a duo. On April 5, 2016, it was announced that Minzy decided to not renew her contract with YG Entertainment and officially left the group and the agency on May 5, 2016. In May 2016, Minzy signed with The Music Works and began preparation for a solo album. On January 17, 2017, Minzy was revealed as a cast member of the second season of . The show aired its first broadcast on February 10, where Minzy was appointed as the main singer, lead dancer and choreographer for the second generation of and was later voted in as the leader of the group in the third episode. The same month, Minzy released her first solo single "I Want To Love" as part of the soundtrack of the MBC drama . On April 3, Minzy announced that her debut solo mini-album will be released on April 17. The same day, she will hold her solo debut stage on . In September, she filed a request to terminate her contract with The Music Works and to be paid 50 million won in compensation. The injunction was denied later that year, as the court overseeing the lawsuit deemed the contract still valid.

members.name: Somi (singer)
members.intro: She made solo debut on June 13, 2019 with the digital single " ". In May 2015, she participated in the reality survival show . She was eliminated in the final episode after achieving 9th place. In 2016, she participated in Mnet's survival television show, as a trainee representing . She finished the survival in first place, becoming the center of the girl group . On May 4, 2016, the group debuted with the mini album , and its title track, "Dream Girls". From October 2016 to April 2017, Somi along with 's were the hosts for the sixth season of the music show . After the disbandment of I.O.I on January 29, Somi signed an official artist contract with , meaning she would be able to pursue solo activities and brand endorsements until her official debut. Later, on February 10, she joined the second season of the variety show, , and debuted as a member of their special girl group in May 2017. Somi then went onto being cast in the reality-drama show, in May 2017, as a representative of I.O.I. She played the role of high school student named Bo-ram, and then later became part of a special girl group named formed by her fellow cast members in July 2017. On August 20, 2018, it was announced that Somi left , and confirmed to have joined 's sub-label on September 23, 2018 . In late November, it was reported that Somi was working on new music with the goal of making a solo debut in March 2019. It was later scheduled for May 1, then delayed to late May, and finally for June 13. Finally, on June 13, Somi debuted as a soloist with the digital single album " ". On music shows, she also performed the other track, "Outta My Head". On July 1, it was announced that I.O.I would make a return under a new agency called Studio Blue. The return would be in October 2019, later delayed to December, with nine members, sadly Somi not being one of them due to her solo activities. On February 7, 2020, she gratuated from Hanlim Arts School.

On September 7, 2018, it was confirmed that the group would be split in two for their future activities, with only the seven Korean members promoting in Korea as VARSITY. It is still unsure whether the five Chinese members will keep promoting in China as VARSITY-V or under another formation.

members.intro: (단; formerly known as (승보)) is a South Korean singer under . He is the leader of the pre-debut boy group and a former member of . Dann moved to Dubai when he was ten-years-old. While working as an English translator at K-CON in 2016, Dann was scouted by CSO Entertainment. On December 20, 2016 Dann (at the time promoting under his birth name Seungbo) was unveiled as a VARSITY member in the second round of debut teasers. He officially made his debut with the group on January 9, 2017 with the single " ". In 2017, VARSITY also auditioned to be on . Dann made it through the auditions and was eventually eliminated in episode 7. On September 7, 2018 VARSITY announced they would be splitting the group in two. The Chinese members were going to promote in China under a new name while the Korean members would continue using the name VARSITY. Since this decision, VARSITY has yet to resume their activity. On January 21, 2020 Dann was formally introduced as a member of .

intro: (언더독) was a boy group under . They debuted on June 14, 2013 with the single "Can't Stop".

members.intro: (용진) is a South Korean singer and songwriter under Illusion Entertainment and Oneworld Entertainment. He is a member of the boy group and a former member of the group . In 2017, Yongjin who represented Illusion Entertainment, participated in survival show . He was eliminated in the episode 8 and finished in 56th place. After the show, he made his solo debut on September 5, 2017 with digital single album " ". Before he released his album, he made a post on Instagram stating that he was diagnosed with glaucoma.

members.name: Ju Won Tak
members.intro: (주원탁) is a South Korean singer. He was a member of the boy group and project group . He made his solo debut on November 26, 2018 with the single "In The Light". In 2016, Won Tak became a member of the boy group under the stage name (로엘). In 2017, he participated in Mnet's survival show , representing but was eliminated in episode 5 and finished in 62nd place. Following the program's conclusion, he, along with other former contestants, debuted as a member of the project group in October 2017 before disbanding a year later. On November 26, 2018, he made his official solo debut with the digital single " ". On May 23, 2019, it was reported Won Tak had submitted certification of contents to terminate his contract with 2ABLE Company. His agency responded that they would take legal action against him after which he released a statement on Instagram explaining that the company's CEO was being investigated for fraud and embezzlement and that he had not received any earnings for his activities while with .

In 2018, after Subin released the OST, two members were added to U-US, making them a group. They presumably disbanded in 2019, without ever releasing music as a group. Subin has since gone solo again under Erum Entertainment.

During the audition rounds, she was placed in F class, but after the re-evaluation round, she was bumped up to C class. She finished in the 36th place. After the show, rumors started emerging that she had signed on with . Initially, she posted on her Instagram that there wasn't a contract yet. But pictures of her with other Dream T trainees were later uploaded by the trainees. In 2017, Kang Xiwon became a part of , a four-member girl group that was formerly under We Can Do It! Entertainment and was later supposed to make their debut under TNK Entertainment, but ultimately disbanded before debuting. In December, 2018, Kang Xiwon's solo debut was announced for 2019. In April 2019, she finally made her debut as a soloist under TNK Entertainment.

intro: (크래비티) is an upcoming 9-member boy group under . They are expected to make their debut on April 14, 2020 with . Their name stands for "Center of Gravity" and combines the words "Creativity" and "Gravity" to bring you into their universe with a unique charm. On February 13, 2020, Starship reveal that they would be debuting a new boy group in the first half of the year with and joining as members. On March 15, Starship opened the group's official SNS accounts and the name revealed to be CRAVITY. The first three members were revealed the following day: Serim, Allen, and Jungmo. On March 17, Woobin, Wonjin and Minhee were revealed, followed by Hyeongjun, Taeyoung, and Seongmin on the 18th.

name: CRAXY
intro: (크랙시) is a five-member girl group under . They debuted on March 3, 2020 with the full-length album . In December 2018, CRAXY, then known by their pre-debut name , was introduced through their winter project. To celebrate Christmas, the members recorded " ", a song made out of several remade popular Christmas songs. They also shot a music video for the song inspired by story. The song would not be released on music sites until June 27, 2019. In 2019, S.A ITAINMENT revealed their plans to give all members a solo song before debuting the group. They started with the release of the music video for Woo-Ah's "Issue" on May 18, followed by Hyejin's "Boyfriend" on August 10, ChaeY's "Sixteen" on August 30, Swan's "My Soul" on September 25, and Karin's "Ka Ka Ka" on October 24. On May 21, the company announced Wish Girls were going to do a summer project. Similar to their winter project, the group will film a music video, but this time related to summer. For this project, they teamed up with the Indonesian actor Glenn Alinskie and his wife actress and singer Chelsea Olivia. The couple worked as co-producer on this project for nearly a year, before the music video for " " was finally revealed on July 12. The single would be released on music sites a month later on August 21. On July 22, S.A ITAINMENT announced an international cover contest for "Yours Is Mine". Two days later, on July 24, the company revealed the prize for the winners: a trip to Korea, recording a song with Wish Girls and shooting a music video. On August 31, the winner of the dance cover contest was announced: Indonesian dance team I'GENERATION On September 6, the winners of the vocal cover contest were announced: Diva from Russia, Gigi from Hong Kong, Aaliyah from Belgium, Laras from Indonesia, and Yoerich from Indonesia. For reasons unknown, however, Gigi and Laras did not participate in the shooting. On December 9, the music video for "We The WishGirls" was released. On December 13, Wish Girls announced their winter project through the "WishXMas" music video teaser featuring all the girls from the WTW project. The music video was released on December 18. At the end of the music video, the group revealed their debut date had been set and coming soon. The date was not revealed, but was shared to fall into the first half of 2020. On January 10, S.A ITAINMENT uploaded a music video teaser for Wish Girl's final pre-debut single " ". With this teaser, they revealed the group's official name to be . On January 16, the music video for "My Universe" was released. One month later, on February 16, the single was officially released on music sites. In February, the group also revealed they were planning to release their debut album on March 1. The album would consist of ten tracks, including the solo and pre-debut songs. The title track was revealed to be "Aria". On March 1, the company posted on their social media that due to internal issues, they were postponing CRAXY's debut until March 3.
