name: WANNA.B
intro: (워너비) was a five-member girl group under . They released a pre-debut single, "My Type", on November 17, 2014 before officially debuting on July 20, 2015 with the single "Attention". They presumably disbanded in 2019. WANNA.B was formed by Zenith Media Contents in 2014 and originally consisted four members: , , and . They released a pre-debut single titled " " on November 17, 2014. In early 2015, Saebom and J.Bin left the group and were replaced with and . In mid-2015, fans were notified about Yoonseul's departure and that they would be adding three new members: , (both former members of , with Eunsom also being a former member of ), and (former member of ). WANNA.B finally debuted on July 20, 2015 with the digital single " ", with the group's line-up consisting of Jiwoo, Siyoung, Sejin, Seoyoon, Eunsom and Ami. They made their first comeback on November 10, 2015 with the single " ". On April 6, Zenith Media Contents announced Seoyoon would be leaving the group due to back pain and that WANNA.B would be adding two new members: (sister of 's ) and . The new seven-member line-up made their first comeback on June 26 with the digital single " ". Some time after the release, Jiwoo and Siyoung had decided to leave the group. After announcing the news on December 26, 2018, member made her solo debut with the digital single " " on January 3. On February 8, the group released the comeback schedule for their fourth digital single, their first comeback in nearly three years. On February 11, the single's title was revealed to be " " with the release of teaser image for the member Ami. Sometime after the release of "Leggo" member Sejin changed her handle and deleted any mention of WANNA.B from her Instagram account, shortly after she was unfollowed by the group's profile. In late 2019, all the remaining members also suddenly renamed their accounts and removed "WANNA.B" from their profile descriptions. This coupled with the fact that the group was deleted from Zenith Content's website and has been inactive since May, strongly suggests that they have disbanded.

intro: (원팀) is a five-member boy group under . They debuted on March 27, 2019 with their first mini album . BC and Rubin had experience in the music industry prior to debut. BC was a former member of the boy group until its disbandment. He was also a former contestant on the idol survival reality show, , and was a member of their pre-debut boy group of the . He later went onto another idol survival reality show, , but was eliminated. Like BC, Rubin was also a former contestant on the idol survival reality show, , a member of BOYS24, and also participated on , but unlike BC, he made it into the top 9 ranks to debut. However, their debut was canceled due to disagreements with contract lengths between and the trainees' individual companies. On December 17, 2018, Liveworks Company released profile images and interview videos of the members for their upcoming boy group, then known as TEAM LWZ. Another set of photos was released on December 24. Liveworks announced on March 4, 2019 that the group will make their debut on March 27 under the name 1TEAM.

Over a year later on December 17, 2018, he was introduced as member of the upcoming boy group (then known as TEAM LWZ). He officially debuted with the group on March 27, 2019 with their debut mini album, .

name: (G)I-DLE
intro: ((여자)아이들) is a six-member girl group under . They debuted on May 2, 2018 with their first mini album . On March 22, published a logo for its third girl group which would debut shortly after 's comeback with . The group already counted with a former contestant of the reality shows and , . From April 8 to April 12, the five members of the group were revealed via social medias, starting with , followed by , , , Soyeon and respectively. The group officially debuted on May 2, with the release of the mini album and its title track "Latata", which was wrote by member Soyeon, as well as the full album. On May 22, "Latata" got its first win at , exactly 20 days after the debut. They won a total of three times during their promotion. On June 16, the group took part of 's concert , which took place at Kintex in Ilsan and counted with , , , and . At midnight KST on January 20, (G)I-DLE posted a teaser photo for "I-Land" throughout their social media. It was revealed on the 23rd through another teaser that the group would be holding their first world tour. On February 28, Cube confirmed that the tour, along with their upcoming album would be postponed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.
